data.text: @SydAlexMom @tomscocca @froomkin I checked the AEC's own records - though it's possible other sites are using not just federal but state and local elections

@zomfies @tomscocca @froomkin There are numerous sites listing AUS with 78-81% #VoterTurnout.
AUS does show as having 90+% of its population as #RegisteredVoters.
Here's one ... scroll ⤵️ ...
https://t.co/h1ihT42eaQ
Google "Voter Turnout Worldwide"
https://t.co/r69L7Iu1il
91.89% #RegVoters with 80.79% VOTING https://t.co/7texRjfrax
@randomjeweler @DKS_Arsenal @AdamMantine @tomscocca Exactly, additional economic measures (like paid sick leave) are needed
@bsviggy @DKS_Arsenal @AdamMantine @tomscocca I was boosted and knocked out for two weeks. How many working Americans can afford that?

@zomfies @tomscocca Untrue. Look at the South Dakota-North Dakota data. South didn’t restrict or mask, North did. Results the same. None of it made any difference, especially masks.  Virus way too small. Vaxxes almost certainly made things worse.

@McNicollb @tomscocca That's clearly not true, and you'd have to be wilfully blind to believe it. People who wore masks - *countries* that implemented true mask mandates early on - have much better results than people/countries that didn't, or did it late. It's why cases spike when mandates vanish.

@zomfies @tomscocca Ignoring the public health diktats and following them to a T produced more or less the same results. That’s the whole point. And if you didn’t overreact and take the vax, then these horrible stories of bad reactions aren’t a problem for you.
@McNicollb @tomscocca That is insane - if it's true, it's only true in that a whole segment of the population ignored the public health strategy: didn't mask, didn't quarantine, didn't get vaccinated
@SydAlexMom @tomscocca @froomkin Who produced that? Voter turnout in Australia has been over 90% since the 1920s.
